getGameFile

public File getGameFile()
                 throws RuntimeException
Brings up a file dialog and asks the user to select the game file to start with

Returns:
returns null if they did not select a file, otherwise the file object
Throws:
RuntimeException

getInstance

public static GuiInterface getInstance()
Returns the single instance of GuiInterface. If it is the first call the object will be created, otherwise the original references will be returned.

Returns:

getUserBattleAction

public String getUserBattleAction()
Displays the Battle Options to the user and waits for a response

Returns:
the Label on the button the user selected

getUserChoiceAction

public String getUserChoiceAction(ArrayList<String> choices,
                                  int displayScreen)
Displays the Choice Options to the user and waits for a response

Parameters:
choices - the labels that should be on the buttons for choices ( limit of 5 )
displayScreen - the screen to show to the user ( user either GuiInterface.STORY_SCREEN or GuiInterface.MAP_SCREEN )
Returns:
the Label on the button the user selected

getUserChoiceAction

public String getUserChoiceAction(String[] choices,
                                  int displayScreen)
Displays the Choice Options to the user and waits for a response

Parameters:
choices - the labels that should be on the buttons for choices ( limit of 5 )
displayScreen - the screen to show to the user ( user either GuiInterface.STORY_SCREEN or GuiInterface.MAP_SCREEN )
Returns:
the Label on the button the user selected

getUserMoveAction

public String getUserMoveAction(boolean up,
                                boolean right,
                                boolean down,
                                boolean left,
                                int displayScreen)
Displays the move Options to the user and waits for a response

Parameters:
up - true if user is allowed to move up, false otherwise
right - true if user is allowed to move right, false otherwise
down - true if user is allowed move down, false otherwise
left - true if user is allowed move left, false otherwise
displayScreen - the screen to show to the user ( user either GuiInterface.STORY_SCREEN or GuiInterface.MAP_SCREEN )
Returns:
the Label on the button the user selected

setUserDisplayMessage

public void setUserDisplayMessage(String message)
Sets the message to display to the user. This message will replace any message that was set before

Parameters:
message - the message to display to the user

showWindow

public void showWindow()
Makes the graphical interface visible on the display Must be called after before any other work is done in the program

turnOnHtmlUserMessageDisplay

public void turnOnHtmlUserMessageDisplay()
Turns on the ability to have html tags embedded in the messages displayed to the user
